taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

bio:treatment.description: Annuals 6–30 cm; vestiture sparsely hispido-pilose, stem hairs spreading at right angles, straight, 0.6–2.4 mm, thick-based. Phyllary apices long-acuminate. Ray florets 13–21. Disc floret corollas: base not swollen and indurate. Cypselae: hairs apically straight; pappi coroniform, ciliate, 0.2–0.7 mm. 2n = 8.
Sand or sandy clay, open scrub oak woodlands, mesquite savannas, fields, disturbed sites, roadsides;
bio:treatment.discussion: Aphanostephus pilosus is recognized by its reduced habit, distinct vestiture, small heads, and long-acuminate phyllary apices.
